turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: We've got pressure.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Clear and open on my mark. Three... two... one... mark.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Jesus its huge.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Ice crystals everywhere. This place is a deep freeze.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: That means they didn't abandon ship.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: So where are they? Starck, any luck with the bio-scan?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Peters is right, no one's here.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I don't know, this place is really dark, I can't see a thing...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I can see the hatch.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Starck, you still showing those readings?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: The blood came from somewhere, Peters...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: There's no one here, Skipper.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Okay. I'm on the bridge.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What you got, Peters?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Everything's been shut down. Conserving power, I guess. Green light on the hull, it's intact.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: The science workstation has power, I'll see if I can find the crew from here.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I found one.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Alive?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Frozen.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Justin, check the containment for radiation leaks. Peters...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: ...how's the client?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Crystallized.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Can anybody hear me...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Skipper...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Peters...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: ...you okay?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Yeah. I'm -- I'm okay.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Peters, I want you to go through the ship's log, see if we can't find some answers.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I can use the station in Medical, keep an eye on Justin...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Fine. Starck, I want you to repeat the bio-scan...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I can run the image through a series of filters, try to clean it up.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: That's a negative, Starck.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Justin.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Peters. We need to know what happened to the crew. Before it happens to us.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I'll get back to the log. But on the bridge, I won't go back, back in there...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Captain Miller, I just want to say...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: The clock is running, Dr. Weir. If you'll follow the rest of the crew, they'll show you to the gravity tanks.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Captain Miller, I appreciate this opportunity...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Doctor Weir, my crew is not going on your mission because we want to. We were pulled off a well deserved leave, to be sent out to the middle of nowhere, and no one's even told us why.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I've been authorized to brief you and the crew once we reach Neptune space.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Until then, do what you're told and stay out of my way.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: It was the ship's maiden voyage, to test the drive. The Event Horizon moved to safe distance using ion thrusters. They received the go-ahead to activate the gravity drive.  And the ship vanished from all our scopes. No radar contact, no enhanced optical, no radio contact of any kind. They disappeared without a trace.  Until now.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Where has it been for the last seven years?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: That's what we're here to find out.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What does it say?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: NSA encryption specialists have deciphered some of the message...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: That's the engineering containment. And there's the main airlock. We can dock there.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Smith, use the arm and lock us onto that antennae cluster.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Be careful. It's not a load bearing structure...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Dr. Weir, I need you on the bridge.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Captain, I didn't come out here to sit on your bridge, I need to be on that ship...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Once the ship is secured, we'll bring you on board --

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: That is not acceptable --

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: -- once we've secured the ship, that's the way it is!  I need you to guide us from the comm station. This is where I need you. Help us to do our job.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: You're in the central corridor. It connects the personnel areas to Engineering.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Peters and I will search the forward decks. Justin, take Engineering. No hot-dogging, not on this one, alright?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I can see that, what're they for?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: In an emergency, the charges detonate in series, destroying the central section and separating the personnel areas from the rest of the ship. That way, if the gravity drive malfunctions, the crew could use the foredecks as a lifeboat.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Easy, Peters, we're okay, we're okay. Let's finish the sweep.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Captain Miller, the foredecks are just ahead.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Any survivors?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Negative.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: No one?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: They're empty, Dr. Weir. Moving forward.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: It beats dying, Mister Smith.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Dr. Weir's right. Get on board the Event Horizon. I'll meet you at the airlock.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: One of my men is down. I want to know what happened to him.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Hold on, what's this "gravitational distortion?"

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: It's possible that a burst of gravity waves escaped from the Core, distorting space-time. They could be what hit the Lewis and Clark.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What could cause them?  What's in the Core?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: It's complicated...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: How much time do you need? We have seventeen hours and forty-two minutes. Now: what is in the Core?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: It's insane.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: "Insane?" The finest astronauts fought to be posted to this ship. It would take the Lewis and Clark a thousand years to reach our closest star. The Event Horizon could be there in a day...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: If it worked.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: If it worked, yes.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I want this room sealed. The Second Containment is off limits.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: There's no danger. The black hole is contained behind three magnetic fields, it's under control.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Your black hole damn near ripped my ship apart. It may have killed one of my men.  No one goes near that thing.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You have something, Dr. Weir?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: The date.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: The Event Horizon's computer think's it's 2034.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Exactly. The ship's internal clock is off by seven years.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Explanation?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Intense gravitational fields effect the passage of time, it's possible...  Black holes make sense on paper, it's all math, you see, but as to what really happened...  The Event Horizon has passed beyond our plane of reality, and like Lazarus, returned from the dead.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What the hell is that? Dr. Weir?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We barely have enough power for life support as it is, if we can't stop the drain, we're not gonna make it.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: The Core...!

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We don't get the power back, our air's gonna go bad.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Check the Core for radiation. Carbon dioxide may be the least of our worries.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We're a long way from home and we're in a bad place. Let's not make it worse. If anyone has any constructive suggestions, now is the time.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I think I can stabilize the fields around the singularity, that should prevent another power drain.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Is that your "expert opinion?" The only answer we've had out of you is "I don't know."

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Justin just tried to kill himself. The man is clearly insane.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I want to know what caused that noise. I want to know why one of my crew tried to throw himself out of the airlock.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Thermal changes in the hull could have caused the metal to expand and contract very suddenly, causing reverberations --

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: That's bullshit and you know it! You built this fucking ship and all I've heard from you is bullshit!

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: What do you want me to say?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You said this ship creates a gateway...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: To what? Where did this ship go? Where did you send it?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Where has it been for the past seven years?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: The "Other Place," what is that...?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I DON'T KNOW!  I don't know. There's a lot of things going on here that I don't understand. Truth takes time.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: That's exactly what we don't have, Doctor.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We're leaving.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: You can't, your orders are specific...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: "...to rescue the crew and salvage the ship." The crew is dead, Dr. Weir. This ship killed them. And now it's killing us.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: You're insane. You've lost your mind.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Maybe you're right. But it's still my command, and I have leeway to abort when I feel there is an unacceptable threat to my crew. And I think there is.  Starck, download all the files from the Event Horizon's computers. Coop, Smith, finish moving the CO2 scrubbers back onto the Clark.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Don't... don't do this...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: It's done.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: What about my ship?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We will take the Lewis and Clark to a safe distance and then launch tac missiles at the Event Horizon until I am satisfied that she has been destroyed.  Fuck this ship.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: You... You can't do that!

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Watch me.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: You can't leave. She won't let you.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Just get your gear back onto the Lewis and Clark, doctor, or you'll find yourself looking for a ride home.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I told you... She won't let you leave...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Your eyes...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I don't need them anymore. Where we're going, we won't need eyes to see.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Do you know what a singularity is, Miller? Does your mind truly fathom what a black hole is?  It is NOTHING. Absolute and eternal NOTHING. And if God is Everything, then I have seen the Devil.  It's a liberating experience.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: If you miss me, you'll blow out the hull. You'll die too.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: What makes you think I'll miss?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Weir is dead.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Then who the fuck are you?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Your fear. Do you remember the Goliath, Miller?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What are you?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: You know.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You want me to believe you're the Devil, well, I don't, that's bullshit!

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I'm not the Devil.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Then what, what are you? Tell me...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Better if I just show you.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: There is no Devil. There is no God. There is only... NOTHING.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You're lying...!

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I'm not asking you to believe me. You'll see for yourself... and so will your crew. You're all coming with me.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Starck... Cooper...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You can't have them. Go to hell.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: NOOO!

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I don't like it either, but you know the rules: we get the call, we go. Is the course locked in?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Locked and cocked.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Heading three-three-four...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: ...Make your approach vector negative fourteen degrees...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: One-four degrees...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: We have a lock on the Event Horizon's navigation beacon. It's in the upper ionosphere, we're in for some chop.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Bring us in tight. Starck, get on the horn, see if anyone's listening...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We're all on edge, Smith. We're a long way out...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: That's not it. That ship was built to go faster than light... That's just wrong, it goes against everything we know...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What are you trying to say? "If God had intended Man to fly, he would have given us wings?"

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Something like that, yeah.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I guess we're about to find out. Keep us slow and steady.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Dr. Weir...!

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: We've got some weather.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I noticed. Starck, anybody home?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: 1500 meters. We're getting too close...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Proximity warning! 900, 800 meters, 700... we're right on top of it, we're gonna hit!

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Starck...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Put it through TACS. Smith, you up for a flyby?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Love to.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: It is now.  We're locked in.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Starck, give me a read.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Captain Miller...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Smith, where the hell have you been?!

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: We have a situation here...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Do we have enough time for a weld?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: We don't have time to fart.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: We're losing pressure at 280 liters a second and our oxygen tanks are cracked. In three minutes, our atmosphere will be gone. We are fucking dead.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: No one's dying on my watch, Smith! What about the reserve tanks?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: They're gone.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You heard me, Smith. Peters, are you with me?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Captain Miller, you copy?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I'm here, Smith, how's the Clark?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: I've found a six inch fracture in the outer hull. We should be able to repair it and re-pressurize, it's gonna take some time.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We don't have time, Smith. In twenty hours we run out of air.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Understood.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: ...you break all the laws of physics, you think there won't be a price? You already killed the first crew...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: That's enough!

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Sir.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Get outside, go back to work. I'll join you shortly.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Captain, we got a problem.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: She was right behind me, I turn around, she's gone. She could be anywhere.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Alright. Prep the Clark for launch. I'll find her.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Skipper...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What is it, Smith?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: I just saw Weir, I think he was messing around on the Clark.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Smith, get out of there...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Come again, Skipper?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: One of the explosives is missing from the corridor. I think Weir may have put it on the Clark.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Get off the Clark now and wait for me at the airlock.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: No, no, we just got her back together...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Get out of there now!

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Where is it, where is it...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Smith? Smith! Fuck!

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: We're past the outer marker, we can engage the ion drive whenever you're ready.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Justin?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Ion drive will engage in... T-minus ten minutes.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Starck, why aren't you on the bridge?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I just finished drying...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Then what are you doing here? Come on, people, let's go!  And Cooper... Put some pants on.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Crossing the horizon. Optimum approach angle is fourteen degrees.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Come around to three-three-four...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Something's wrong with the bio-scan.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Radiation interference?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: There's not enough radiation to throw off the scan. I'm picking up trace life forms, but I can't get a lock on the location.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: That's an affirmative.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Keep your eyes open.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Everybody okay?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: We're all here.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Okay. Let's find out how much time we just bought.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: It tastes bad.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: But you can breathe it.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: The antennae array's completely fried, we've got no radio, no laser, no highgain... No one's going to be coming to help us.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: How much oh-two do we have?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Oxygen is not the problem.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Carbon dioxide?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: It's building up with every breath we take. And the CO2 filters on the Event Horizon are shot.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We can take the filters from the Clark...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I thought of that, with the filters from the Clark, we've got enough breathable air for twenty hours. After that, we'd better be on our way home.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What about the life readings you picked up?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: The Event Horizon sensors show the same thing: "Bio-readings of indeterminate origin." Right before that wave hit the Clark, there was some kind of surge, right off the scale, but now it's back to its previous levels.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What's causing the readings?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I don't know, but whatever it is, it's not the crew.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: So where is the rest of the crew? We've been over every inch of this ship and all we've found is blood. Dr. Weir? Any suggestions?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: What's the point? I'll just get the same thing...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Not acceptable. I want to know what's causing those readings. If the crew is dead, I want the bodies, I want the crew found.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I can reconfigure the scan for C-12, amylase proteins.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Do it. Dr. Weir...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Maybe one of the original crew?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: No. It was someone else.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Dr. Weir, you were right there, you must have heard something, seen something...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Miller...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What is it, Starck?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: ...I ran the bio-scan with the DNA/RNA filter. The results were bio-readings of indeterminate origin...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: "...bio-readings of indeterminate origin," don't you have anything useful to tell me?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I've got a theory.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: There was a another surge in the bio- readings right before you... you saw what you saw. We picked up a similar readings right before the Clarke was damaged. What if there were a connection between the two? The gravity waves, the hallucination, all part of an defensive reaction, like an immune system...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: You've got to listen...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: To what? What are you saying? This ship is alive?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I didn't say that, I said the bio- readings correspond to what happened to you, the ship is reacting to us...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We're hanging on by our fingernails and you're giving me bullshit stories...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: It's not bullshit, it's the only conclusion the data supports...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Starck, do you know how crazy that sounds? It's impossible.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: If you knew it was impossible, then why'd you waste my time?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I thought you wanted an answer. And that's the only one I have.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What I want is to survive the next ten hours.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Nine hours and twenty-two minutes.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I'm going outside to work on the Clark. And Starck... don't tell anyone what you just told me. We've got enough to worry about.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Miller, come in...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What's going on in there, Starck?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Justin's in the airlock.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: He's awake, he's in the airlock, he's not wearing a suit.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Stay here! Don't stop working!

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I'm on my way, Starck.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: You better hurry. He's engaged the override, we can't open the inner door.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Tuck yourself into a crouched position, shut your eyes as tight as you can!

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Five seconds.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Weir can't be alive.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Whatever was on that bridge wasn't Weir.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Weir activated the drive. He's sending us to the Other Place.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: We've got to shut it down, we've got to...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: BLOW THE FUCKER UP.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Blow it up?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We blow the Corridor. Use the foredecks as a lifeboat, separate it from the rest of the ship. We stay put...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I'll do it --

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: No. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: We're armed. This fucker's ready to blow...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: ...repeat, we're armed...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Miller, he's back, he was in the tank...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Weir.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: He's dead...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: First time in a grav couch?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Don't worry about it. He's hard, but he's fair. You're lucky to be shipping out with him. He's one of the few Captains in the service with experience in the Outer Reach.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: He's been past Mars?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: He served on the Goliath.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Wasn't that ship destroyed?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: They attempted to rescue a supply shuttle bound for Titan. The shuttle's oh-two tanks ruptured during the rescue, flooded both ships with pure oxygen. There was a spark and both ships were incinerated. The Skipper and three others just made it to a lifeboat. Captain Miller was able...
